# FACTORY REPORT

## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Power Generation System at (-9.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
- Offshore pump at position (-9.5, -0.5)
- Boiler at position (-5.0, 2.5)
- Steam engine at position (0.5, 6.5)
- Connected with pipes for water and steam flow

### Coal Mining Operation at (18.5, 11.5)
Consists of:
- Electric mining drill at position (18.5, 11.5)
- Wooden chest at position (18.5, 13.5) for coal collection
- Connected to power grid

### Oil Processing System at (17.5, 40.5)
Consists of:
- Pumpjack at position (17.5, 40.5) extracting crude oil
- Oil refinery at position (24.5, 44.5) set to basic oil processing
- Storage tank at position (30.5, 45.5) for petroleum gas
- Connected with pipes and power

### Plastic Production Facility at (36.5, 48.5)
Consists of:
- Chemical plant at position (36.5, 48.5) set to produce plastic bars
- Coal input wooden chest at position (34.5, 46.5)
- Coal inserter at position (35.5, 46.5) to feed coal from chest to chemical plant
- Plastic output wooden chest at position (39.5, 48.5)
- Output inserter at position (38.5, 48.5) to move plastic bars from chemical plant to chest
- Connected to petroleum gas storage tank with pipes
- Connected to power grid

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when placing entities in occupied spaces
- Check for existing entities (especially pipes) before placing new entities
- When using `place_entity_next_to`, consider increasing the spacing parameter if placement fails
- Be aware of entity collision boxes that may extend beyond their visual representation

### Errors when placing inserters near mining drills
- Mining drills have a large collision box (3x3) that prevents inserters from being placed directly adjacent
- Use a larger spacing parameter or choose a different direction when placing entities next to mining drills

### Errors when connecting entities with pipes
- Ensure that entities are properly aligned and within connection range
- Some entities have specific connection points that must be respected
- When connecting distant entities like boilers and steam engines, ensure a valid pipe path exists between them

### Errors with power connections
- Chemical plant showing "NO_POWER" status despite being near electric poles suggests power network issues
- Ensure all machines are within the connection radius of electric poles
- Check that the power generation system is working correctly and producing enough electricity

### Production issues
- When a machine shows "ITEM_INGREDIENT_SHORTAGE", ensure all required inputs are available
- For recipes requiring multiple inputs (like plastic bars needing both coal and petroleum gas), verify all inputs are being supplied
- Check that inserters are correctly oriented to pick up from source and drop into destination
